metadata.title: MeeMaw's Recipe Collection
metadata.note: Recipes modified to use egg substitutes for eggs and vegetable oils for lard, shortening, and animal fats

original_recipe.name: Marinated Peppers
instructions: Bake whole peppers in oven at 350° F to 375° F for 30 minutes or more until wilted - turn from time to time while baking.
Mix all other ingredients and let stand while peppers are baking.
Skin the peppers, core, remove seeds, and cut into small slices.
Pour marinade over peppers (add 2 tablespoons of capers, if desired) and let stand until cool, or overnight if time permits.

improved_recipe.name: Marinated Roasted Peppers
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350–375°F (175–190°C). Line a baking sheet with foil for easier cleanup.
Place the whole red peppers on the baking sheet. Roast for 30–40 minutes, turning occasionally, until the skins are blistered and the peppers are very soft.

While the peppers roast, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, sugar, dried basil, and a few grinds of black pepper in a small bowl. If using capers, you can stir them into the marinade now.
When the peppers are done, transfer them to a bowl and cover tightly (or place them in a paper bag) for 10–15 minutes to steam. This loosens the skins.
Peel off the skins, remove stems and seeds, and cut the pepper flesh into strips.
Combine the warm pepper strips with the marinade (and capers, if using). Toss gently until everything is well coated.
Let the peppers cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight for best flavor.
Serve at cool room temperature as an appetizer, side dish, or part of an antipasto platter.

original_recipe.name: Mushroom and Nut Pate
instructions: Melt margarine in a large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms, onion, and garlic. Saute until the liquid has evaporated. Set aside.
Coarsely chop almonds in food processor or blender. Remove and set aside 2 tablespoons of chopped almonds. Continue processing remaining almonds while slowly adding oil until mixture is well blended.
Add mushrooms and seasonings. Blend thoroughly. Stir in reserved chopped almonds and parsley or sesame seeds. Chill for two hours before serving.
Yield: 1 cup. 55 calories per tablespoon.

improved_recipe.name: Mushroom and Almond Pâté
instructions: Melt the margarine in a large skillet over medium heat.

Add the sliced mushrooms, chopped onion, and minced garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 8–10 minutes, until the mushrooms release their liquid and it has evaporated, and the vegetables are soft and lightly browned. Let cool slightly.
In a food processor or blender, coarsely chop the slivered almonds. Remove 2–3 tablespoons and reserve for garnish, if desired.
With the processor running, slowly drizzle in the vegetable oil and process until the almonds form a thick, spreadable paste.

Add the cooked mushroom mixture, dried oregano, dried thyme, and a dash of hot sauce to the processor. Blend until the mixture is fairly smooth but still has a little texture, scraping down the sides as needed.
Taste and adjust seasoning with additional hot sauce and a pinch of salt, if desired.
Transfer the pâté to a small bowl or crock. Smooth the top and sprinkle with the reserved chopped almonds and a little chopped parsley or sesame seeds, if you like.
Cover and chill for at least 2 hours to allow the flavors to blend. Serve cold or cool with crackers, sliced baguette, or raw vegetables.

original_recipe.name: The Little English Muffin Pizza
original_recipe.source: Favorite Appetizer of Drew Carle - Created for Drew by his Grandmother Alma Finken Carle
instructions: Spread each muffin half with pizza sauce. Quantity of sauce used will vary depending on taste. Cover with mozzarella cheese in desired quantity and sprinkle with bacon bits.
Bake in toaster oven at 400° for ten minutes, or until cheese is bubbly. Serve hot.

improved_recipe.name: Little English Muffin Pizzas
instructions: Preheat the oven or toaster oven to 400°F (200°C).
Arrange the English muffin halves, cut side up, on a baking sheet.
Spread each muffin half with 1–2 tablespoons of pizza sauce.
Top each with 2–3 tablespoons of grated mozzarella cheese and sprinkle with bacon bits.
Bake for about 8–10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the muffin edges are lightly crisp.
Serve hot. Makes 4 small pizzas.

original_recipe.name: Confectioner's Glaze

ingredients.item: Vanilla, rum, maple, lemon, or any other extract

instructions: Mix 2 tablespoons of hot water with 2 teaspoons of extract.
Add slowly to powdered sugar, mixing well.
Continue adding hot water until mixture is of the desired consistency.

improved_recipe.name: Easy Confectioner's Sugar Glaze
improved_recipe.servings: About 2 cups (enough for cookies, cakes, or sweet rolls)

ingredients.notes: start with 2, add more as needed
vanilla, rum, maple, lemon, or any flavor

instructions: In a medium bowl, sift the powdered sugar if it is at all lumpy.
In a small bowl or cup, combine 2 tablespoons hot water with the extract of your choice.
Add the liquid to the powdered sugar and stir with a spoon until smooth.
Add more hot water, 1 teaspoon at a time, stirring well after each addition, until the glaze reaches your desired consistency. For a thin drizzle, make it thinner; for spreading, keep it thicker.
Use immediately to glaze cookies, cakes, or sweet rolls. The glaze will set as it cools.

original_recipe.name: Fluffy Cocoa Frosting
original_recipe.servings: Enough for two 10-inch layers, or three 9-inch layers
instructions: Sift cocoa and powdered sugar together.
Add remaining ingredients and beat to desired consistency, adding more liquid, if necessary.
Makes enough for two ten-inch layers, or three nine-inch layers.

improved_recipe.name: Rich Cocoa Buttercream Frosting
improved_recipe.servings: Enough to frost a 2-layer 9-inch or 10-inch cake
instructions: Sift together the cocoa powder and powdered sugar into a mixing bowl.
Add the vegetable oil, vanilla extract, and 1/2 cup of buttermilk or evaporated milk.
Beat with an electric mixer at medium speed until smooth and fluffy, about 2 minutes.
If the frosting is too thick, add additional buttermilk, 1 tablespoon at a time, until it reaches a good spreading consistency.
Use immediately to frost cooled cakes or cupcakes. The frosting will set slightly as it stands.

original_recipe.name: Fluffy White Frosting
instructions: Combine all of the ingredients in the top of a double boiler and cook over rapidly boiling water while beating with a rotary beater or an electric beater until the frosting is stiff.
Remove from heat and add one teaspoon of vanilla.
Beat again until vanilla is well blended.

improved_recipe.name: Seven-Minute Fluffy White Frosting
instructions: Fill the bottom of a double boiler with water and bring to a rapid boil over high heat.
In the top of the double boiler (off heat), combine the egg whites, sugar, corn syrup, water, cream of tartar, and salt.
Place the top pan over the boiling water and immediately begin beating with a handheld electric mixer at high speed.
Continue beating constantly for about 7 minutes, or until the frosting forms stiff, glossy peaks.
Remove from heat, add the vanilla extract, and beat for another minute until the vanilla is fully incorporated and the frosting is very fluffy.
Use immediately to frost a cooled cake, spreading with a spatula to create swirls and peaks. The frosting will set as it cools.

original_recipe.name: Orange-Cream Cheese Frosting
instructions: Position knife in food processor bowl; add cottage cheese. Process one minute or until smooth.
Add vanilla, cream cheese, and grated orange rind; process until smooth.
Add powdered sugar; pulse three to five times until mixture is smooth.
Yield: 1 & 1/2 cups.

improved_recipe.name: Creamy Orange-Cream Cheese Frosting
instructions: Place the cottage cheese in a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Process for about 1 minute, or until completely smooth with no lumps.
Add the softened cream cheese, vanilla extract, and orange zest. Process until well combined and very smooth, about 30 seconds.
Add the sifted powdered sugar. Pulse 3-5 times, then process briefly until the frosting is smooth and creamy.
Taste and adjust sweetness if desired by adding a bit more powdered sugar.
Use immediately to frost a cooled carrot cake, spice cake, or other baked goods. Store any leftover frosting covered in the refrigerator.

original_recipe.name: Cocktail Sauce
instructions: Mix well.

improved_recipe.name: Classic Shrimp Cocktail Sauce
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine the catsup, chili sauce, Worcestershire sauce, horseradish, hot sauce, and celery salt.
Stir well until fully mixed.
Add the lemon juice if using, and stir again.
Taste and adjust the horseradish and hot sauce to your preferred level of heat.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.
Serve chilled with boiled shrimp, crab, or oysters. Store covered in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

original_recipe.name: Tomato Sauce
instructions: Saute onion and garlic in oil.
Add remaining ingredients.
Simmer for 10 minutes.

improved_recipe.name: Quick Italian Tomato Sauce
improved_recipe.servings: About 4 cups (enough for pasta or stuffed shells)
instructions: Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and cook, stirring frequently, until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more, stirring constantly so it doesn't burn.
Stir in the tomato juice, tomato paste, chili sauce, salt, sugar, and pepper. Add dried basil or Italian seasoning if using.
Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce heat to low.
Simmer uncovered for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has thickened slightly and the flavors have blended.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Use as a sauce for pasta, stuffed shells, lasagna, or pizza.

original_recipe.name: Frosted Pineapple Squares

ingredients.notes: at room temperature, or egg substitute

instructions: Mix 1/2 cup sugar, cornstarch, and salt together in a saucepan. Add pineapple (with juice) and milk and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a boil and thickens. Set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, thoroughly mix 1 1/3 cups of flour, 1 teaspoon sugar, and the dry yeast.
Heat margarine and water (and milk if specified) until warm to the touch, then add to the flour-yeast mixture and beat at medium speed of an electric mixer, scraping the bowl occasionally.
Add 4 egg yolks and 1/2 cup flour, or just enough flour to make a thick batter. Beat well. Stir in enough additional flour to make a soft, moist dough.
Turn dough out onto a floured board and knead until smooth and elastic.

Divide dough in half. Roll out half of the dough on a floured board and fit into a greased jelly-roll pan or baking sheet. Spread cooled pineapple filling over the dough. Roll out remaining dough and place over the filling. Snip surface of the top dough with scissors to let steam escape.
Cover and let rise in a warm place, free from drafts, until doubled in bulk.
Bake at 350–375°F (175–190°C) until golden brown. Cool and frost with confectioners' sugar frosting. Cut into squares to serve.

improved_recipe.name: Frosted Pineapple Squares

ingredients.notes: room temperature (plus 1 extra yolk used in filling)

instructions: Make the pineapple filling: In a medium saucepan, whisk together sugar, cornstarch, and salt. Stir in the pineapple (with its juice) and the milk.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a full boil and thickens to a spoon-coating consistency. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature.
Make the dough sponge: In a large bowl, combine about 1 1/3 cups (160 g) of the flour, the 1 teaspoon sugar, and the dry yeast.
Warm the water and margarine together until just warm to the touch (105–115°F / 40–46°C). Add to the flour-yeast mixture and beat on medium speed for 2–3 minutes, scraping the bowl occasionally.
Beat in the egg yolks and another 1/2 cup (60 g) of flour. Continue adding just enough of the remaining flour to form a soft, slightly sticky dough.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead 8–10 minutes, adding flour only as needed, until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl, turn to coat, cover, and let rise in a warm, draft-free place until doubled, about 1 hour.
Lightly grease a jelly-roll pan (about 10x15 in / 25x38 cm). Divide the dough in half. Roll one half to fit the bottom of the pan and transfer it to the pan.
Spread the cooled pineapple filling evenly over the dough in the pan.
Roll the remaining dough to the same size and place over the filling. Pinch edges to seal and snip the top in several places with scissors to allow steam to escape.
Cover and let rise again until puffy, 30–45 minutes.
Near the end of rising, preheat the oven to 350–375°F (175–190°C).
Bake 25–35 minutes, or until the top is deep golden brown and the bread sounds hollow when tapped.
Cool completely in the pan. Drizzle with confectioners' sugar frosting and cut into squares to serve.

original_recipe.name: Meringue
original_recipe.tableNote: Metric conversions: 9-inch (90g whites, 1g tartar, 75g sugar); 8-inch (60g whites, 1g tartar, 50g sugar); 6-inch (30g whites, 0.5g tartar, 25g sugar)
instructions: Beat egg whites until frothy, add cream of tartar, and continue beating until stiff enough to hold a point.
Gradually beat in sugar, continuing to beat until mixture is stiff and glossy.
Slow and complete blending of sugar prevents beads of sugar in meringue.
Pile meringue lightly on cooled pie filling, sealing it onto the edge of the crust to prevent shrinking.
Swirl or pull up points to make it look decorative.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes (until a delicate brown) in a slow oven (300°F) to set and bake the meringue so it will hold up.
Let cool at room temperature away from drafts, as cold air makes it fall and condenses moisture on top of the filling.

improved_recipe.name: Meringue for 9-inch Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C). Prepare a fully baked pie with cooled filling.
In a clean, grease-free bowl, beat egg whites on medium speed until frothy.
Add cream of tartar and continue beating until soft peaks form.
Gradually add sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating constantly, until stiff, glossy peaks form and all sugar is dissolved.
Pile the meringue lightly over the cooled filling, spreading to seal completely to the crust edge to prevent shrinking.
Swirl the surface or pull up points with the back of a spoon for a decorative finish.
Bake 15–20 minutes, until the meringue is set and lightly golden.
Cool at room temperature, away from drafts, before serving.

original_recipe.name: Blueberry Pie Filling

ingredients.quantity: 3 tbsp with fresh berries OR 5 tbsp with frozen berries
Thin layer for bottom of crust

instructions: Boil one cup of blueberries with water and sugar; strain.
Add cornstarch (3 tbsp with fresh, 5 tbsp with frozen) to the hot liquid and cook over medium heat, stirring with a wire whisk, until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat and add lemon juice.
Stir in the remaining blueberries.
Before putting blueberry mixture in baked crust, line the bottom of the crust with a thin layer of softened cream cheese. Cool.
Spread light Cool Whip on top before serving.

improved_recipe.name: Blueberry Pie Filling
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine 1 cup (150 g) of the blueberries with the water and sugar. Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook a few minutes until the berries begin to soften.
Strain the mixture to remove the berry skins, returning the liquid to the saucepan.
Whisk the cornstarch into a small amount of cool water to make a smooth slurry, then whisk into the hot blueberry liquid.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a full boil and thickens and becomes glossy.
Remove from the heat and stir in the lemon juice, then gently fold in the remaining blueberries.
Let the filling cool until just warm.
Spread a thin layer of softened cream cheese over the bottom of a cooled, baked 9-inch pie shell.
Pour the blueberry filling into the shell and smooth the top. Chill until fully set.
Before serving, spread or dollop light whipped topping over the pie if desired.

original_recipe.name: Cherry Pie Filling (Quick)
instructions: Mix sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a saucepan.

Drain the cherries and measure the juice; add water if needed to reach the required amount (implied). Add juice to the pan and cook, stirring with a wire whisk, until thickened and the syrup comes to a boil.
Remove from heat and stir in almond extract, grated orange rind, and cherries.
Line the bottom of the baked pie shell with a thin layer of low-fat cream cheese.
Pour in the cherry sauce and chill.
Spread light Cool Whip over pie before serving.

improved_recipe.name: Quick Cherry Pie Filling

ingredients.notes: to bring reserved juice to 1 cup / 240 ml

instructions: Drain the canned cherries and reserve the juice. Add enough water to the juice to make 1 cup (240 ml).
In a medium saucepan, whisk together sugar, cornstarch, and salt.
Gradually whisk in the cherry juice mixture until smooth.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and comes to a full boil.
Remove from the heat and stir in almond extract, grated orange rind, and the drained cherries.
Let the cherry mixture cool until just warm.
Spread the softened cream cheese in a thin layer over the bottom of a cooled, baked 9-inch pie shell.
Pour the cherry filling into the crust and smooth the top. Chill until fully set.
Before serving, spread or dollop light whipped topping over the pie.

original_recipe.name: Karo Nut Pie

ingredients.notes: each half broken into four pieces

instructions: Combine all of the ingredients EXCEPT THE NUTS and beat well with an electric mixer.
Add the nuts, blend, and pour mixture into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 325°F for 40 minutes, or longer if necessary.
Wilfred Carle's favorite pie to eat!

improved_recipe.name: Karo Nut Pie (Pecan Pie Style)
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Place a baking sheet on the center rack to catch any drips.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together Karo syrup, sugar, melted margarine or butter, eggs, and vanilla until smooth.
Stir in the pecan pieces until evenly distributed.
Pour the filling into the unbaked 9-inch pie shell.
Bake 35–45 minutes, until the center is just set and only slightly jiggles when gently shaken. If the crust browns too quickly, cover the edge with foil.
Cool completely on a rack before slicing.
notes: Wilfred Carle's favorite pie to eat!

original_recipe.name: Peanut Butter Pie
instructions: Combine peanut butter and powdered sugar. Mix until crumbly. Spread 3/4 of this mixture in baked pie shell.
Combine 2/3 cup sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a saucepan. Add scalded milk and mix well.

Pour this mixture into the beaten egg yolks (with margarine) a small amount at a time, stirring constantly, then return to the top of a double boiler and cook until thickened. Add vanilla and blend well.

Pour filling into the baked pie shell and top with meringue made from the three egg whites. Sprinkle remaining peanut butter and powdered sugar mixture on top. Continue baking until meringue is browned.

improved_recipe.name: Peanut Butter Cream Pie

ingredients.notes: or use Meringue recipe in this section

instructions: Prepare the crumb layer by mixing powdered sugar and crunchy peanut butter with a fork until crumbly. Reserve about 1/4 of the mixture for topping and press the remaining 3/4 evenly into the bottom of a cooled, baked 9-inch pie shell.
In a heavy saucepan, whisk together sugar, cornstarch, and salt.
Gradually whisk in the hot scalded milk until smooth.
In a separate bowl, beat egg yolks with the softened margarine.
Slowly whisk a ladleful of the hot milk mixture into the egg yolk mixture to temper, then return the egg mixture to the saucepan.
Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until the custard thickens and just begins to bubble. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
Pour the hot custard into the prepared pie shell over the peanut butter crumbs.
Prepare a meringue with the 3 egg whites and sugar (or use the Meringue recipe in this section). Spread the meringue over the hot filling, sealing to the crust.
Sprinkle the reserved peanut butter crumb mixture over the meringue.
Bake at 325–350°F (165–175°C) until the meringue is golden brown. Cool completely before serving.

original_recipe.name: Pumpkin Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Combine filling ingredients in the order given and mix well.
Pour into 9" unbaked homemade pie shell with high fluted edge.
Bake at 425°F initially, then reduce temperature (details implied) and bake until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool. Spread light Cool Whip on top before serving, if desired.

improved_recipe.name: Pumpkin Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Place a baking sheet on the middle rack.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs until blended.
Add pumpkin, sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves. Whisk until smooth.
Gradually whisk in the evaporated milk until the filling is well combined.
Place the unbaked 9-inch pie shell on the hot baking sheet. Pour the filling into the shell.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 15 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and continue baking 35–45 minutes, or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean or the center registers about 190°F (88°C).
Cool on a wire rack. Chill if you like a firmer texture.
Top with whipped topping before serving, if desired.

original_recipe.name: Strawberry Glaze Pie (French)
instructions: Line the bottom of a cooled baked 9" pie shell with the cream cheese. Cover this with the choicest half of the strawberries.
Mash and strain the remaining strawberries until juice is extracted; if necessary, add a little water to make 1 1/2 cups of juice.
Put juice in a pot over heat and bring to the boiling point. Gradually stir in a mixture of the sugar and cornstarch.
Cook over moderate heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and cool slightly, then pour over the strawberries in the pie shell. Chill in refrigerator for about two hours.
Remove from refrigerator about 20 minutes before serving to take chill from the crust.
Spread light Cool Whip on top before serving.

improved_recipe.name: Strawberry Glaze Pie

ingredients.notes: to bring berry juice to 1 1/2 cups / 360 ml

instructions: Reserve the nicest half of the strawberries to remain whole. Slice them in half if large.
Mash the remaining berries and strain through a sieve to extract juice. Add enough water to make 1 1/2 cups (360 ml) of liquid.
In a saucepan, whisk together sugar and cornstarch.
Gradually whisk in the strawberry juice mixture until smooth.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a boil and thickens and turns glossy.
Remove from heat and let cool until just warm.
Spread softened cream cheese in a thin layer over the bottom of a cooled, baked 9-inch pie shell.
Arrange the reserved whole strawberries over the cream cheese, cut side down if halved.
Pour the warm glaze evenly over the berries, coating them well.
Chill for at least 2 hours, until set.
Remove from the refrigerator about 20 minutes before serving to take the chill off the crust. Top with whipped topping, if desired.

original_recipe.name: Brownies
instructions: Melt margarine and stir in sugar. Add eggs and vanilla.
Combine cocoa, flour, salt, and baking powder. Stir into sugar mixture.
Fold in nuts if using.
Spread in greased 9x9 inch pan.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes. Do not overbake.
Cool and cut into squares.

improved_recipe.name: Brownies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x9 inch (23x23 cm) baking pan or line with parchment.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the melted margarine or butter and sugar until glossy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
In a separate bowl, whisk together cocoa, flour, salt, and baking powder.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir just until blended. Fold in nuts if using.
Spread the batter evenly in the prepared pan.
Bake 25–30 minutes, until the edges are set and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with a few moist crumbs (not wet batter). Do not overbake.
Cool completely in the pan, then cut into squares.

original_recipe.name: Fluffy Buttermilk Biscuits
instructions: Pre-heat oven to 450° F.
Sift dry ingredients together.
Combine oil, buttermilk, and flavoring without stirring and add all at once to dry ingredients.
Stir with a fork until mixture clings together and forms a ball.
Knead on a lightly floured board ten to twelve times with your fingertips.
Pat out dough from one-half to one inch in thickness.
Cut with a floured two-inch biscuit cutter.
Place on a baking sheet coated with a nonstick vegetable spray.
Bake in a PREHEATED oven for about ten minutes.

improved_recipe.name: Fluffy Buttermilk Biscuits
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C). Lightly coat a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a small bowl or measuring cup, combine the vegetable oil, buttermilk, and butter flavoring (if using). Do not stir—just combine them gently.
Pour the liquid mixture all at once into the dry ingredients.
Stir quickly with a fork just until the mixture clings together and forms a shaggy ball. Do not overmix.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured board or clean work surface.
Using just your fingertips (not your palms), gently knead the dough 10-12 times until it just comes together.
Pat or roll the dough out to 1/2 to 1 inch thickness.
Cut biscuits with a floured 2-inch biscuit cutter, pressing straight down without twisting.
Place the biscuits on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the tops are golden brown.
Serve hot with butter, jam, or honey.

original_recipe.name: Pizza Dough (Crusty)
instructions: Sprinkle yeast over warm water in warmed bowl; let stand five minutes.
Add salt, olive oil and 2 & 1/2 cups of flour. Mix for two minutes.
Add remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, until dough clings to hook and cleans sides of bowl.
Knead for 5 minutes.
Place in bowl coated with nonstick vegetable spray. Cover; let rise in warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.
Punch down. Roll out and shape on pan that has been sprinkled with cornmeal.
Top as desired.
Bake at 425° F for about 20 minutes.

improved_recipe.name: Homemade Crusty Pizza Dough
improved_recipe.servings: Dough for two 12-inch pizzas or one large sheet pizza
instructions: In a large warmed mixing bowl, sprinkle the yeast over the warm water. Let stand for 5 minutes until the yeast is foamy.
Stir in the salt, olive oil, and 2 1/2 cups of the flour. Mix with a wooden spoon or a stand mixer with a dough hook for about 2 minutes.
Gradually add more flour, 1/2 cup at a time, mixing or kneading until the dough clings together, pulls away from the sides of the bowl, and is no longer sticky.
Knead the dough for 5 minutes (by hand on a floured surface or with a dough hook) until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a bowl coated with nonstick spray or lightly oiled. Turn the dough to coat all sides.
Cover the bowl with a damp towel or plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place (about 80°F) until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch down the dough to release air bubbles.
Divide the dough in half for two round pizzas, or leave whole for one large sheet pizza.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out each portion into the desired shape and thickness.
Transfer to a pizza pan or baking sheet sprinkled with cornmeal.
Top with your favorite pizza toppings.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 18-22 minutes, or until the crust is golden and crispy and the cheese is bubbly.

original_recipe.name: Baked Rice Custard

ingredients.item: Eggs, slightly beaten, or egg substitute

ingredients.notes: heat milk in microwave or on stovetop for 3-4 minutes or until film forms on top of milk

instructions: Combine eggs, sugar, vanilla and salt; beat well.
Stir in remaining ingredients.
Pour even amounts of mixture into four prepared custard cups.
Place custard cups in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Pour hot water into pan to a depth of 1 inch.
Bake at 325 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until knife inserted comes out clean.
Serves 4.

improved_recipe.name: Classic Baked Rice Custard

ingredients.notes: scalded (heated until steaming with a film on top)

instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Lightly coat four custard cups or a 1-quart baking dish with nonstick spray.
In a medium bowl, beat together the eggs, sugar, vanilla, and salt until well combined.
Heat the milk in a saucepan or microwave until it is scalded (steaming hot with a film on top, but not boiling). This takes about 3-4 minutes in the microwave or 5 minutes on the stovetop.
Slowly pour the hot milk into the egg mixture, whisking constantly to prevent the eggs from cooking.
Stir in the cooked rice, raisins, and cinnamon until evenly distributed.
Divide the mixture evenly among the four custard cups, or pour it all into a baking dish.
Place the cups or dish in a larger baking pan. Carefully pour hot water into the pan to reach about 1 inch up the sides of the custard cups (this is a water bath, or bain-marie).
Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean and the custard is just set.
Carefully remove from the water bath and let cool slightly.
Serve warm or chilled, dusted with a little extra cinnamon if desired.

original_recipe.name: Bread Pudding
instructions: Heat oven to 325° F.
Coat a 2-quart baking dish with a nonstick vegetable spray.
Spread a generous amount of margarine on one side of each slice of bread and line the bottom and sides of the baking dish with the slices.
Mix together the milk, eggs, sugar, salt, raisins, vanilla, and cinnamon.
Pour this over the bread. Place extra pieces of bread on top and press them down gently so they are submerged.
Let stand about 10 minutes, a little longer if the bread is particularly dry.
Bake covered for 30 minutes, then uncover and bake for 30 more minutes.
For a crustier top, slip the dish under a hot broiler a few minutes until the pudding surface is deep golden.
Serve warm with a pitcher of heavy cream (we do not use the cream).
Note: Use a good quality bread with a texture like homemade (French or Italian). Do not use bread so stale that it is hard. DO NOT USE soft, bakery bread.

improved_recipe.name: Classic Bread Pudding
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Coat a 2-quart baking dish with nonstick spray.
Spread a generous amount of margarine or butter on one side of each slice of bread.
Arrange the bread slices, buttered side up, in the bottom and slightly up the sides of the prepared baking dish, overlapping as needed.
In a large bowl, whisk together the milk, beaten eggs, sugar, salt, raisins, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg (if using) until well combined.
Pour the milk mixture evenly over the bread in the baking dish.
If you have extra bread slices, tear them into pieces and place them on top, pressing down gently so they are submerged in the custard.
Let the pudding stand for about 10 minutes to allow the bread to soak up some of the liquid. If your bread is very dry or stale, let it stand a bit longer.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 30 minutes, or until the pudding is set in the center and the top is golden brown.
For an extra-crispy top, place the pudding under a hot broiler for 2-3 minutes, watching carefully to prevent burning.
Let cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serve warm, plain or with a drizzle of cream, caramel sauce, or a dusting of powdered sugar.

original_recipe.name: Cranberry or Blueberry Crunch
instructions: Mix oatmeal, sugar, flour, salt, and margarine as a pastry crust.
To make the sauce, combine 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water in a large saucepan. Stir to dissolve sugar. Heat to boiling; boil for 5 minutes.

Add 1/2 lb. (about 2 cups) of fresh berries; cook until the skins pop (about 15 minutes so that it will 'jell' when dropped on a cold plate). Remove from heat. This can be used immediately or chilled before using.
Coat a baking dish (a large pie pan) with a nonstick vegetable spray.
Use 1/2 of the pastry crust mixture, 'patting' it down gently.
On top of this, put the 1 and 1/2 cups of cranberry sauce - DO NOT spread to the outer edges of the shell.
Cover this sauce with the remaining crumbs, patting them down gently; seal the edges well.
Bake in preheated oven at 350° for about 30 minutes or until lightly brown.

improved_recipe.name: Cranberry or Blueberry Crunch
instructions: First, make the berry sauce: In a medium saucepan, combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water. Stir to dissolve the sugar, then bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil for 5 minutes.

Add the fresh cranberries or blueberries and cook, stirring occasionally, until the berry skins pop and the mixture thickens, about 15 minutes. To test for doneness, drop a spoonful onto a cold plate—it should jell slightly.
Remove from heat and let the sauce cool slightly. You can use it warm or refrigerate until ready to use.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Coat a 9-inch pie pan or similar baking dish with nonstick spray.

For the crumb mixture: In a medium bowl, combine the oats, 3/4 cup sugar, flour, and salt. Add the cold margarine or butter and work it in with your fingers or a pastry cutter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press half of the crumb mixture gently and evenly into the bottom of the prepared baking dish to form a crust.
Spread 1 1/2 cups of the prepared berry sauce over the crust, leaving a small border around the edge so the filling doesn't spread to the very edge.
Sprinkle the remaining crumb mixture evenly over the top of the berry filling, patting it down gently. Press the edges to seal.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and the filling is bubbling around the edges.
Let cool for at least 15 minutes before serving. Serve warm or at room temperature, plain or with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

original_recipe.name: Turkey Sausage
original_recipe.source: Wilfred F. and Alma Finken Carle
instructions: Blend wheat germ with vegetable oil and let stand over night.
Add the wheat germ mixture to the ground turkey breast and mix well.
Add the remaining ingredients. Items may be added or omitted and quantities increased or decreased to suit taste.
Mix well; if too dry, add a little water.

improved_recipe.name: Turkey Breakfast Sausage

ingredients.notes: adds body and a nutty flavor

ingredients.item: Red pepper flakes or ground red pepper

instructions: In a small bowl, stir together the wheat germ and vegetable oil until evenly moistened. Cover and let stand at room temperature overnight, or at least 1 hour.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground turkey, sage, coriander, black and white pepper, red pepper, cumin, thyme, garlic, Old Bay, and salt.

Add the wheat germ mixture and mix thoroughly with clean hands until the seasonings are evenly distributed and the mixture feels cohesive but not dry. If it seems crumbly, sprinkle in 2–4 tablespoons (30–60 ml) cold water and mix again.
For best flavor, cover and refrigerate the sausage mixture for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Shape into patties or logs for links, using about 1/4 cup (60 g) of mixture per patty.

To cook, brown sausage over medium heat in a lightly oiled skillet, 4–5 minutes per side, until cooked through (internal temperature 165°F / 74°C). Alternatively, shape into logs and bake on a parchment-lined tray at 375°F (190°C) for 18–22 minutes, turning once.
Serve hot with eggs and potatoes, or cool and freeze cooked patties for quick breakfasts.

original_recipe.name: Pizza (Carle Version)

ingredients.quantity: 1 can (4 oz), stems and pieces, drained
as desired, sliced (green, yellow, or red)
as desired, cut in small strips

instructions: Prepare crust according to package instructions.
Spray pizza pan with a nonstick vegetable cooking spray and then sprinkle pan with a thin layer of cornmeal.
Place dough in center of pan and dampen finger tips with water, then spread dough by pressing it out well to the edge of the pan.
Bake at 450° F for 10 to 15 minutes, until light brown.
Remove from oven and put pizza sauce on crust. Use whatever quantity you prefer and spread it with a spoon.
Add cut up toppings in quantities desired.
Put back in oven and bake another 15 minutes. Remove and cover with grated or sliced Mozzarella cheese.
Bake another 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

improved_recipe.name: Family Pan Pizza (Carle Version)

ingredients.notes: or equivalent homemade dough for one 12–14 inch pan
such as Ragu Pizza natural sauce

instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C). Prepare the pizza crust dough according to package or recipe directions.
Spray a round or rectangular pizza pan with nonstick cooking spray and sprinkle with 1–2 tablespoons (10–20 g) cornmeal.
Place the dough in the center of the pan. With damp fingertips, gently press and stretch the dough out to the edges, keeping the thickness even.
Par-bake the crust for 8–10 minutes, until just set and lightly golden at the edges.
Remove from the oven and spread 1–1 1/2 cups (240–360 ml) pizza sauce over the crust, leaving a small border.
Distribute sliced onion, olives, mushrooms, bell pepper, and ham or turkey ham evenly over the sauce.
Return the pizza to the oven and bake for 10–15 minutes, until the toppings are hot and the crust is golden.
Remove from the oven, top generously with grated or sliced Mozzarella cheese, and bake 5–8 minutes more, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Cool a few minutes, then cut into wedges or squares and serve.

original_recipe.name: Fettuccine Primavera
instructions: Cook pasta as directed on package, adding broccoli and carrots during last 5 minutes of cooking.
Stir together milk, neufchatel cheese, onions and seasoning in medium saucepan over low heat until smooth.
Stir in turkey and Parmesan cheese.
Toss pasta and vegetables with sauce. Serve immediately. Makes six servings. Preparation time is 25 minutes.

improved_recipe.name: Fettuccine Primavera with Smoked Turkey
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add fettuccine and cook according to package directions.
During the last 5 minutes of pasta cooking time, add the broccoli florets and carrot slices to the boiling water with the pasta.
While the pasta cooks, combine the milk, neufchatel cheese, green onion, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder in a medium saucepan.
Cook over low heat, stirring frequently, until the cheese is fully melted and the sauce is smooth and slightly thickened.
Stir the smoked turkey and Parmesan cheese into the sauce and heat gently until warmed through. Do not boil.
Drain the pasta and vegetables well and return them to the pot or a large serving bowl.
Pour the hot sauce over the pasta and vegetables and toss gently to coat.
Serve immediately, with extra Parmesan at the table if desired.

original_recipe.name: Jumbo Shells No. 1 - Spinach-Ricotta Filling
instructions: In a large saucepan combine the fresh spinach with a small amount of water. Cook, covered, until wilted and tender. Squeeze the spinach to remove excess moisture. Chop spinach.
In a skillet cook onion in margarine till tender but not brown. Add spinach; heat through.
Combine egg, ricotta, Parmesan, nutmeg and spinach mixture.
Pour half of the sauce in a baking dish. Stuff (20) shells with filling, arrange in dish and top with remaining sauce.
Bake in 350° oven 30 minutes.
FOR TOMATO SAUCE SEE RECIPE THIS SECTION AND/OR ON BACK OF THIS RECIPE.

improved_recipe.name: Jumbo Shells with Spinach-Ricotta Filling

ingredients.notes: use family tomato sauce recipe from this cookbook

instructions: Cook the jumbo pasta shells in plenty of salted boiling water according to package directions until just al dente. Drain, rinse briefly with cool water, and set aside to dry on a towel-lined tray.
Meanwhile, place the fresh spinach in a large saucepan with just the water clinging to the leaves. Cover and cook over medium heat, stirring once or twice, until wilted and tender.
Drain the spinach in a colander and, when cool enough to handle, squeeze out as much moisture as possible. Chop finely.
In a small skillet, melt the margarine or butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until tender but not browned. Stir in the chopped spinach and heat through. Let cool slightly.
In a mixing bowl, combine the beaten egg, ricotta, Parmesan, nutmeg, and the spinach-onion mixture. Stir until evenly blended and season lightly with salt and pepper if desired.
Lightly oil or spray a baking dish large enough to hold the stuffed shells in a single layer. Spread about half of the tomato sauce over the bottom of the dish.
Using a spoon, fill each shell with a generous amount of the spinach-ricotta mixture and arrange the shells in the baking dish in a single layer.
Spoon the remaining tomato sauce over the shells, covering them well so they do not dry out.
Cover the dish with foil and bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 30 minutes, until the filling is hot and the sauce is bubbling.
Let stand 5–10 minutes before serving. Serve with extra Parmesan at the table.

original_recipe.name: Jumbo Shells No. 2 - Meat Filling
instructions: Saute chopped meat in olive oil until brown. Mix with egg, or egg substitute, cheese, bread crumbs, parsley, salt and pepper.
Pour half of the sauce in a baking dish. Stuff (20) shells with filling, arrange in dish and top with remaining sauce.
Bake in 350° oven 30 minutes.
FOR TOMATO SAUCE SEE RECIPE THIS SECTION AND/OR ON BACK OF THIS RECIPE.

improved_recipe.name: Jumbo Shells with Meat Filling

ingredients.notes: use family tomato sauce recipe from this cookbook

instructions: Cook the jumbo pasta shells in salted boiling water until just al dente. Drain, rinse briefly with cool water, and set aside on a towel-lined tray.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef or chicken and cook, breaking it up with a spoon, until browned and cooked through. Drain off any excess fat.
Transfer the cooked meat to a mixing bowl. Stir in the beaten egg, Parmesan cheese, chopped parsley, seasoned bread crumbs, and a little salt and pepper. Mix until evenly combined.
Lightly oil or spray a baking dish large enough to hold the shells in a single layer. Spread about half of the tomato sauce over the bottom.
Fill each shell with a generous spoonful of the meat mixture and arrange the shells in the baking dish in a single layer.
Pour the remaining tomato sauce evenly over the stuffed shells.
Cover with foil and bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 30 minutes, until heated through and bubbling.
Let rest 5–10 minutes before serving. Serve with extra Parmesan and a green salad.

original_recipe.name: Spaghetti Portofino (Serves One)

ingredients.quantity: small handful, cut in small strips

ingredients.notes: if not available, use same quantity of fish

instructions: Combine ingredients in order listed, prepared at the table:

Warm garlic in oil and margarine in skillet over medium flame (do not brown). Add fish and saute briefly, then add brandy and carefully ignite. When flame goes out add mussels and rest of the ingredients.
Add spaghetti, simmer one to two minutes. Serve with salad and French bread.

improved_recipe.name: Spaghetti Portofino (For One)

ingredients.notes: or use additional fish if mussels are not available

instructions: Have the cooked spaghetti hot and ready to add to the sauce.
In a medium skillet over medium heat, warm the garlic in the olive oil and melt the butter. Do not let the garlic brown.
Add the strips of fish and saute for 1–2 minutes until just opaque on the outside.
Carefully add the brandy and, if desired, ignite with a long match, letting the alcohol flame off. When the flame goes out, add the mussels.
Stir in Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, oregano, Tabasco, chunky tomato sauce, catsup, parsley, and white wine. Bring just to a simmer.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet and toss in the sauce for 1–2 minutes until well coated and heated through.
Serve immediately with salad and French bread.

original_recipe.name: Spaghetti Portofino (Serves Six)
instructions: Combine ingredients in order listed.
Warm garlic in olive oil and margarine in wok (medium heat).
Add fish and saute about three minutes. Add brandy and rest of ingredients. Add spaghetti and bring to a simmer.
Serve with salad and French bread.

improved_recipe.name: Spaghetti Portofino (Serves Six)
instructions: Have the spaghetti cooked and kept warm.
In a large wok or deep skillet, heat the olive oil and melt the butter or margarine over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and cook gently for 1–2 minutes, without browning.
Add the strips of fish and saute about 3 minutes, just until opaque on the outside.
Stir in the brandy and allow it to simmer for a minute; if desired, carefully ignite and let the flame burn off.
Add Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, fresh basil, Tabasco, chunky tomato sauce, catsup, parsley, and white wine. Bring the sauce to a gentle simmer.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the pan and toss in the sauce until heated through and well coated.
Serve immediately in warm bowls with salad and French bread.

original_recipe.name: Baked Lasagna Casserole
instructions: In a large heavy pan, brown ground beef in oil with onion, garlic and parsley.
Add tomato paste, 2 cups of water, salt and pepper and simmer for one hour.
Meanwhile, cook Lasagna as directed on package.
Mix together eggs and ricotta or cottage cheese.

In 13"x9"x2" baking pan that has been coated with a nonstick vegetable spray, spread about 1/2 cup of sauce, then alternate layers of lasagna, sauce, ricotta and egg mixture, and mozzarella until baking pan is filled.
Top with sauce and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake in a moderate oven at 375° F for about 30 minutes, or until heated through. Makes 8 servings.

improved_recipe.name: Classic Baked Lasagna
instructions: Cook the lasagna noodles according to package directions until al dente. Drain, rinse with cool water, and lay flat on a towel to prevent sticking.

Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large heavy skillet or saucepan over medium heat. Add the ground beef, onion, garlic, and parsley. Cook, breaking up the meat with a spoon, until the beef is browned and the onion is tender.
Stir in the tomato paste, water, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and simmer gently for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. The sauce should thicken.
In a medium bowl, beat the eggs lightly, then stir in the ricotta or cottage cheese until well combined.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly coat a 13x9x2-inch baking dish with nonstick spray.
Spread about 1/2 cup of the meat sauce over the bottom of the prepared dish.
Layer 4 lasagna noodles over the sauce, overlapping slightly. Spread half of the ricotta mixture over the noodles, then add a third of the remaining sauce, and a third of the mozzarella.
Repeat the layers: noodles, remaining ricotta mixture, half of the remaining sauce, and half of the remaining mozzarella.
Top with the remaining noodles, the rest of the sauce, the rest of the mozzarella, and sprinkle generously with Parmesan cheese.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and lightly golden.
Let the lasagna stand for 10-15 minutes before cutting into squares and serving.

original_recipe.name: Chili
instructions: Grind chicken, chuck, and onions together.
Add olive oil and saute in covered heavy pot until meat is done.
Add seasoning, tomato sauce, chopped tomatoes, and garlic buttons.
Simmer in covered pot for 1 & 1/2 hours, stirring from time to time.
Add chili beans and simmer for another 1/2 hour, or longer if desired. Stir from time to time.

improved_recipe.name: Hearty Chicken and Beef Chili

ingredients.notes: such as Williams Cajun Chili Seasoning

instructions: Cut the chicken breast into small cubes or grind it coarsely using a food processor or meat grinder. Also grind or finely chop the onions.
Heat the olive oil in a large, heavy pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Add the ground chicken, ground beef, and chopped onions. Cook, breaking up the meat with a spoon, until the meat is browned and cooked through and the onions are tender, about 10-12 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and the chili seasoning. Stir well and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in the tomato sauce and diced tomatoes with their juices. Bring to a simmer.
Cover the pot, reduce heat to low, and simmer gently for 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.

Add the chili beans with their sauce and stir well. Continue to simmer, covered, for another 30 minutes to 1 hour, stirring from time to time, until the chili is thick and the flavors are well blended.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
Serve hot in bowls, topped with shredded cheese, sour cream, chopped onions, or your favorite chili toppings.

original_recipe.name: Chicken Casserole (Vocla Poulet Denomandine)
original_recipe.subtitle: Prepare ahead and refrigerate overnight
instructions: Mix together bread stuffing, margarine and water.
Put one-half of the mixture in a 9" x 13" casserole that has been coated with a nonstick vegetable spray.
Mix together, chicken, onion, chives, celery, mayonnaise and salt.
Put in casserole over bread mixture, then top with remaining bread mixture.
Beat eggs slightly, and add milk. Stir. Pour this mixture evenly over bread mixture.
Cover with foil and refrigerate overnight.
Take out one hour before baking.
Spread the cream of mushroom soup over the top.
Bake uncovered in oven at 325°F for one hour.

improved_recipe.name: Make-Ahead Chicken and Stuffing Casserole
instructions: Coat a 9x13-inch casserole dish with nonstick spray.
In a medium bowl, mix together the bread stuffing, melted margarine, and water until combined.
Spread half of the stuffing mixture evenly over the bottom of the prepared casserole dish.
In another bowl, combine the diced chicken, chopped onion, green onions, celery, mayonnaise, and salt. Mix well.
Spread the chicken mixture evenly over the stuffing layer in the casserole.
Top with the remaining stuffing mixture, spreading it evenly.
In a small bowl, beat the eggs lightly, then stir in the milk.
Pour the egg and milk mixture evenly over the entire casserole.
Cover tightly with aluminum foil and refrigerate overnight (or at least 8 hours).
Remove from refrigerator 1 hour before baking to bring to room temperature.
Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C).
Spread the undiluted cream of mushroom soup evenly over the top of the casserole.
Bake uncovered for 1 hour, or until the casserole is hot and bubbly and the top is lightly golden.
Let stand for 5-10 minutes before serving.

original_recipe.name: Chicken/Rice Casserole
instructions: Mix soups and water, stir in rice in large casserole dish or baking pan that has been coated with a nonstick vegetable oil.
Place chicken, dipped in melted margarine, on top, and cover.
Cook at 300°F about 2 hours.
Uncover and brown.

improved_recipe.name: Easy Chicken and Rice Bake

ingredients.item: Cream of chicken or celery soup

instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C).
Coat a large casserole dish or 9x13-inch baking pan with nonstick spray.
In the prepared dish, mix together both cans of soup and the water until smooth.
Stir the uncooked rice into the soup mixture, spreading it evenly in the pan.
Dip each piece of chicken in the melted margarine to coat, then place the chicken pieces on top of the rice mixture, skin-side up if using skin-on pieces.
Season the chicken with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil.
Bake covered for 2 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through and the rice is tender.
Remove the foil and increase the oven temperature to 375°F (190°C). Bake uncovered for an additional 15-20 minutes to brown the chicken.
Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

original_recipe.name: Chicken/Brown Rice Bake
instructions: Saute onion in oil until crisp-tender. Add curry powder, and cook one minute, stirring constantly.
Add chicken broth; bring mixture to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer fifteen minutes.
Stir in rice; cover and cook over heat fifty minutes or more until liquid is absorbed.

Stir in vegetables and chicken. (Note: while original recipe does not call for it, at this point it is recommended that a cup of water or chicken broth be added. Otherwise, the rice will be a little too firm).
Spoon into a 12"x8"x2" baking dish that has been coated with a nonstick vegetable spray.
Cover and bake at 350°F for 30 to 35 minutes.

improved_recipe.name: Curried Chicken and Brown Rice Bake
instructions: In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until crisp-tender, about 3-4 minutes.
Stir in the curry powder and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly, until fragrant.
Add the 3 cups of chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in the brown rice. Cover and continue cooking over low heat for 50-60 minutes, or until the rice is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed.
Stir in the frozen mixed vegetables, chopped chicken, and the additional 1 cup of broth or water. Mix well.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Coat a 12x8x2-inch baking dish with nonstick spray.
Spoon the rice and chicken mixture into the prepared baking dish.
Cover tightly with foil and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until heated through and the vegetables are tender.
Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

original_recipe.name: Tofu-Cheese Stuffed Shells
instructions: Cook pasta shells according to packaging directions. Drain. Rinse with cold water. Drain and set aside.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan cook carrot and green onion in a small amount of water until tender. Drain.
For filling, in a medium mixing bowl, mash tofu with a fork.
Stir in the carrot-onion mixture, ricotta cheese, cheddar cheese, 1/4 cup of the mozzarella, the egg white, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper.
For sauce, in a saucepan combine undrained tomatoes, tomato paste, basil, oregano, sugar, garlic powder, and fennel seed.
Bring to a boil; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered for 10 minutes.
Stuff each cooked shell with about one rounded tablespoon of filling.
Place shells in an un-greased 8"x8"x2" baking dish.
Pour sauce over shells. Top with remaining mozzarella cheese.
Bake, covered, in a 350° F oven for 25 minutes, or until hot.

improved_recipe.name: Vegetarian Tofu-Cheese Stuffed Shells
instructions: Cook the jumbo pasta shells according to package directions until al dente. Drain, rinse with cold water, and set aside on a towel.
In a small saucepan, cook the shredded carrot and green onion in 2-3 tablespoons of water until tender, about 3-4 minutes. Drain well.
In a medium bowl, mash the tofu with a fork until crumbly.
Add the cooked carrot and green onion, ricotta, cheddar, 1/4 cup of the mozzarella, beaten egg white, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
In a medium saucepan, combine the undrained diced tomatoes, tomato paste, basil, oregano, sugar, garlic powder, and fennel seeds (if using).
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Spoon about 1/3 of the tomato sauce into the bottom of an ungreased 8x8x2-inch baking dish.
Stuff each cooked shell with a heaping tablespoon of the tofu-cheese filling.
Arrange the stuffed shells in a single layer in the baking dish.
Pour the remaining sauce over the shells, covering them evenly.
Sprinkle the remaining 1/4 cup mozzarella cheese over the top.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes, or until hot and bubbly.
Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

original_recipe.name: Royal Rice

ingredients.quantity: 3 cups CHEFWAY CONDITIONED rice cooked in chicken or beef broth

instructions: Saute onions in margarine until tender.
Add rice, mushrooms and salt.
Heat thoroughly.
Fluff lightly with a fork. Makes six servings.

improved_recipe.name: Royal Rice Pilaf

ingredients.notes: cooked in chicken or beef broth

instructions: Prepare the rice ahead of time in chicken or beef broth so it is cooked, fluffy, and still warm or at room temperature.
In a large skillet, melt the margarine or butter over medium heat.
Add the chopped green onions and saute 3–4 minutes until tender but not browned.
Stir in the drained mushrooms and cook 1–2 minutes more.
Add the cooked rice, breaking up any clumps with a fork or spatula. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper.
Toss gently over medium heat until the rice is hot throughout and evenly coated with the butter and vegetables.
Taste and adjust seasoning with additional salt or pepper, if needed.
Fluff with a fork and serve hot as a side dish with roasted or grilled meats or fish.

original_recipe.name: Hush Puppies
instructions: Heat water until it boils. Add any garlic or onion at this time.
Add cornmeal slowly into the boiling water as you stir the mixture.
Keep stirring and cooking until the mixture thickens.
Remove from heat and add the egg (not necessary to beat the egg) or egg substitute. Stir until well mixed.
Let stand until cool enough to handle.
Take a spoonful at a time between your hands (moisten hands slightly with water and hush puppies will not stick to them) and shape into a finger-size roll.
Place on a cookie sheet and cover with wax paper.
Let set at least one hour until you fry them in the fat that the fish was fried in.
Fry until golden brown and crispy on the outside.

improved_recipe.name: Traditional Hush Puppies

ingredients.quantity: As needed for deep or shallow frying

instructions: In a medium saucepan, bring the water to a full boil over medium-high heat.
If using onion and/or garlic, stir them into the boiling water and cook 1 minute to soften.
Reduce heat to low. While stirring constantly with a wooden spoon or whisk, slowly pour in the cornmeal in a thin stream to avoid lumps.
Cook, stirring continuously, until the mixture is thick and pulls away from the sides of the pan, 2–4 minutes.
Remove from heat. Stir in the salt, then add the egg and mix quickly until fully incorporated and the batter is smooth and thick.
Let the mixture stand until it is cool enough to handle and firm enough to shape, about 15–20 minutes.
With slightly damp hands, scoop about 1 tablespoon of dough at a time and roll into short logs or small balls, about finger size. Set formed hush puppies on a parchment-lined tray.
Heat frying oil or reserved fish-frying fat in a deep pot or skillet to 350–365°F (175–185°C).
Fry the hush puppies in batches without crowding, turning occasionally, until deep golden brown and crisp on the outside, 3–4 minutes.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle lightly with extra salt while hot, if desired.
Serve warm alongside fried fish or other seafood.

original_recipe.name: Broccoli and Rice

ingredients.quantity: 3 cups (1 cup raw long grain rice)

instructions: Saute chopped onions in margarine.
Add frozen chopped broccoli and cook until broccoli is tender.
Add cheese whiz and cream of chicken soup. Stir until cheese whiz is melted.
Add 3 cups of cooked rice. Salt and pepper according to taste.
Put in a baking dish that has been coated with a nonstick vegetable spray.
Bake at 350° F for 20 or 30 minutes, or until "bubbling good".

improved_recipe.name: Cheesy Broccoli and Rice Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Coat a 2-quart baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large skillet, melt the margarine over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté for 3–4 minutes until softened.
Add the frozen broccoli to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the broccoli is tender and heated through, about 5–7 minutes.
Stir in the cheese sauce and cream of chicken soup, mixing until the cheese is fully melted and the mixture is smooth.
Add the cooked rice and stir until everything is well combined. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and spread evenly.
Bake for 20–30 minutes, or until the casserole is hot throughout and bubbling around the edges.
Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve as a side dish with chicken, pork, or beef.

original_recipe.name: Roasted Nuts
instructions: Combine nuts and margarine.
Roast for 30 to 40 minutes at 250° F, checking every ten minutes.

improved_recipe.name: Oven-Roasted Nuts

ingredients.notes: unsalted, any combination of pecans, walnuts, almonds, cashews, etc.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 250°F (120°C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easier cleanup.
Place the nuts in a large bowl. Drizzle with the melted margarine or butter and sprinkle with salt if using.
Toss until all the nuts are evenly coated.
Spread the nuts in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 30–40 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes, until the nuts are fragrant and lightly toasted. Watch carefully so they do not burn.
Remove from the oven and let cool completely on the pan; they will crisp as they cool.
Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1–2 weeks.

original_recipe.name: Cheese Dip (Like Mexico Chiquito's)
original_recipe.subtitle: Styled after the famous dip from Mexico Chiquito's restaurant

ingredients.notes: minced or mashed, or to taste

instructions: Make the bechamel sauce by melting the margarine and stirring in the flour. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, for one minute.
Add paprika, mustard, cumin, catsup, chili powder, and jalapeno pepper juice.
Gradually stir in the milk, stirring constantly. Continue to stir while cooking until thickened.
Add minced jalapeno pepper, garlic powder, and grated cheese. Cook over low heat until cheese melts.

improved_recipe.name: Cheese Dip (Like Mexico Chiquito's)
instructions: Melt the margarine in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat.
Stir in the flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 1–2 minutes to make a roux (do not let it brown).
Add the paprika, dry mustard, cumin, ketchup, chili powder, and jalapeno juice. Stir well.
Gradually pour in the milk, whisking constantly to avoid lumps. Increase heat slightly and cook, stirring, until the mixture thickens and comes to a gentle simmer.
Reduce heat to low. Stir in the minced jalapeno, garlic powder, and grated cheese. Continue stirring until the cheese melts and the dip is smooth.
Taste and adjust seasoning, adding more jalapeno or chili powder for extra heat if desired.
Serve warm with tortilla chips, vegetables, or as a topping for nachos.

original_recipe.name: Chocolate Fondue
original_recipe.subtitle: Cook's Word of the Week

ingredients.notes: cake pieces, cookies, marshm allowed, cherries, mandarin oranges, pineapple chunks, strawberries

instructions: Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat, and stir in cocoa.
Add sugar and evaporated milk. Return to low heat and cook, stirring constantly, until smooth.
Remove from heat; stir in vanilla. Serve warm with assorted dippers.

improved_recipe.name: Chocolate Fondue

ingredients.notes: such as pound cake cubes, cookies, marshmallows, fresh strawberries, pineapple chunks, mandarin orange segments, cherries

instructions: Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over low heat.
Remove the pan from the heat and whisk in the cocoa powder until smooth.
Stir in the sugar and evaporated milk, mixing until well combined.
Return the pan to low heat. Cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture is smooth, hot, and slightly thickened. Do not let it boil.
Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla extract.
Transfer the fondue to a fondue pot or small slow cooker to keep warm, or serve immediately in a bowl.
Arrange your choice of dippers on a platter and enjoy!

original_recipe.name: Crab Dip
original_recipe.subtitle: Low-fat appetizer (44 calories per serving)
instructions: Combine yogurt, mayonnaise, cream cheese, and seasonings. Mix well.
Then, stir in cheddar cheese and crab. Cover, and chill for two hours.
Sprinkle with paprika. Serve with crackers, breadsticks, or vegetables.

improved_recipe.name: Low-Fat Crab Dip

ingredients.item: Non-fat plain Greek yogurt or sour cream

instructions: In a medium bowl, combine the yogurt, mayonnaise, and softened cream cheese. Stir or beat until smooth.
Add the horseradish, dry mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and hot pepper sauce. Mix well.
Fold in the shredded cheddar cheese and flaked crab meat until evenly distributed.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours to let the flavors blend.
Before serving, sprinkle the top with paprika for color.
Serve chilled with crackers, toasted baguette slices, breadsticks, or fresh vegetables.

original_recipe.name: Roasted Nuts
instructions: Spread the nuts on a shallow pan.
Roast uncovered in a slow oven (300° F) for 30 to 40 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
Sprinkle with salt.

improved_recipe.name: Simple Roasted Nuts
instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C).
Spread the raw nuts in a single layer on a large rimmed baking sheet or shallow pan.
Roast uncovered for 30-40 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes, until the nuts are lightly browned and fragrant.
Remove from the oven and immediately sprinkle with salt while still hot. Toss to coat evenly.
Let cool completely on the pan.
Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 weeks.
Variations: Add other seasonings like garlic powder, cayenne pepper, or rosemary along with the salt for flavored roasted nuts.

original_recipe.name: The Little English Muffin Pizza
instructions: Split English muffins and place on a cookie sheet or toaster oven tray.
Spread each half with pizza sauce.
Sprinkle with mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Top with pepperoni or Italian sausage if desired.
Bake in a toaster oven or regular oven until cheese is melted and bubbly.

improved_recipe.name: Quick English Muffin Pizzas
instructions: Preheat your toaster oven or regular oven to 375°F (190°C).
Split the English muffins in half and arrange them cut-side up on a baking sheet or toaster oven tray.
Spread about 1 tablespoon of pizza sauce on each muffin half.
Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese evenly over the sauce.
Add a light dusting of Parmesan cheese.
If desired, top with pepperoni slices, cooked sausage, or other favorite pizza toppings.
Sprinkle with a pinch of Italian seasoning if you like.
Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted, bubbly, and lightly golden.
Let cool for 1-2 minutes before serving.
Great for quick lunches, after-school snacks, or easy appetizers!

original_recipe.name: Popcorn Balls
instructions: Put popped corn in large bowl.
Combine sugar, water, corn syrup, salt, and vinegar in heavy saucepan.
Bring to a boil and cook until it reaches 250° F.
Add vanilla.
Pour syrup over popped corn.
Stir quickly to coat all kernels.
When cool enough to handle, butter hands lightly and shape into balls.

improved_recipe.name: Old-Fashioned Popcorn Balls
instructions: Place the popped popcorn in a very large bowl, removing any unpopped kernels.
In a heavy saucepan, combine the sugar, water, corn syrup, salt, and vinegar.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves.
Continue cooking without stirring until the mixture reaches 250°F (hard-ball stage) on a candy thermometer.
Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla extract.
Immediately pour the hot syrup over the popcorn in the bowl.
Using a wooden spoon, stir quickly to coat all the popcorn evenly with the syrup.
As soon as the mixture is cool enough to handle, butter your hands lightly.
Working quickly, shape the popcorn into 3-inch balls, pressing firmly to hold the shape.
Place the popcorn balls on waxed paper or parchment to cool completely.
Wrap individually in plastic wrap or cellophane for storage or gift-giving.
Store at room temperature for up to 3 days.

original_recipe.name: Banana Nut Bread
instructions: Cream sugar and margarine. Add egg beaters; beat well.
Sift in flour, soda, cinnamon, and cloves; beat well.
Mix in bananas and nuts.
Pour into loaf pan coated with a nonstick vegetable spray; bake one hour at 325° F.

improved_recipe.name: Banana Nut Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Coat a 9×5-inch loaf pan with nonstick spray or line with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream together the sugar and softened margarine until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs (or egg substitute) until well combined.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and cloves.
Add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture and stir until just combined (do not overmix).
Fold in the mashed bananas and chopped nuts until evenly distributed.
Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top.
Bake for 60–70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely before slicing.

original_recipe.name: Cornbread - Southern Style with Buttermilk
instructions: Pre-heat oven to 425° F. (350° F in a convection oven).
Coat a nine-inch square pan (or 12 muffin cup pan) with a nonstick vegetable spray.
Sift dry ingredients together into a large bowl.
Beat egg whites with an electric beater until stiff.
Combine with buttermilk and oil.
Pour the liquid ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir quickly to make a smooth batter. DO NOT OVER MIX!
Pour into prepared pan or muffin cups.
Bake corn bread for twenty to twenty-five minutes; muffins for ten to fifteen minutes.

improved_recipe.name: Southern-Style Buttermilk Cornbread
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C) or 350°F (175°C) if using a convection oven.
Spray a 9-inch square baking pan or a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together both cornmeals, flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites with an electric mixer until they form stiff peaks.
Gently fold the buttermilk and vegetable oil into the beaten egg whites. Add food coloring if desired.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir just until combined. Do not overmix—a few lumps are fine.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan or divide evenly among muffin cups.
Bake cornbread for 20–25 minutes, or muffins for 10–15 minutes, until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let cool for 5 minutes before cutting into squares or removing muffins from the tin. Serve warm with butter and honey.

original_recipe.name: Cranberry Bread

ingredients.quantity: 1 (juice & grated rind to 3/4 of a cup)

instructions: Sift dry ingredients.
Add juice, rind, egg beaters, and oil. Mix until dampened.
Add nuts and cranberries; mix.
Bake in loaf pan that has been coated with a nonstick vegetable spray at 325° F for 50 to 60 minutes.
Cool before slicing.

improved_recipe.name: Orange Cranberry Bread

ingredients.quantity: as needed to make 3/4 cup total liquid

instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan or coat with nonstick spray.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl or measuring cup, combine the fresh orange juice and grated rind, then add enough water to make 3/4 cup total liquid. Stir in the beaten egg and oil.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir just until moistened and combined. The batter will be slightly lumpy.
Gently fold in the halved cranberries and chopped nuts, distributing them evenly.
Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 50–60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean and the top is golden brown.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
For best flavor and easier slicing, wrap and refrigerate overnight before serving.

original_recipe.name: Pumpkin Bread
instructions: Combine flour, soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and sugar in large mixing bowl.
Add eggs OR egg substitute, water, oil, and pumpkin; stir until blended.
Add nuts; mix well.
Pour mixture into 3 one pound coffee cans that have been coated with a non-stick vegetable spray.
Bake 1 hour at 350°.
Cool slightly in cans; turn out on rack to finish cooling.

improved_recipe.name: Spiced Pumpkin Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Generously grease three 1-pound coffee cans or three 8x4-inch loaf pans, or spray with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the sifted flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and sugar.
In a separate bowl, combine the beaten eggs, water, vegetable oil, and pumpkin puree. Whisk until smooth and well blended.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir just until combined. Do not overmix.
Fold in the chopped pecans, distributing them evenly throughout the batter.
Divide the batter evenly among the three prepared cans or loaf pans, filling each about two-thirds full.
Bake for 60–70 minutes, or until a toothpick or skewer inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let the loaves cool in the cans or pans for 10–15 minutes, then carefully turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Wrap the cooled loaves in plastic wrap or foil and let rest overnight for easier slicing and richer flavor.

original_recipe.name: Dinner Rolls (Alma Finken Carle)

ingredients.item: Sifted bread flour (can use all purpose flour)

instructions: Sift together about 1/3 of the flour and all of the yeast.
Heat milk, oil, sugar and salt over low heat until hot to the finger, but no more. Stir to dissolve sugar and salt.
Add liquids to the flour-yeast mixture and beat with an electric mixer at medium speed for two minutes, or 300 strokes by hand.
Add another one-half to one cup of flour and beat for another minute with the electric mixer.
Stir in enough more flour to make a soft dough.
Turn onto a floured board and knead until smooth and elastic (eight to ten minutes).
Place in a bowl that has been coated with a nonstick vegetable spray. Spray the top of the mixture with the nonstick vegetable spray.
Cover with wax paper and over that place a dry cloth. Put in a warm place (80° to 85° F), free from drafts, and let rise until doubled (about one hour).
Punch dough down. Turn out onto a floured board again and shape into any desired form.
Place rolls on baking sheets that have been lightly coated with a nonstick vegetable spray, or in muffin cups and let rise again until doubled (takes one to one & one-half hours).
Pre-heat oven to 425° F. Bake for about ten minutes and serve "piping hot".

improved_recipe.name: Classic Dinner Rolls (Alma Finken Carle)
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine about 1 cup of the flour with all of the yeast. Mix well.
In a small saucepan, heat the milk, oil, sugar, and salt over low heat until warm to the touch (105-115°F), stirring to dissolve the sugar and salt. Do not overheat.
Pour the warm liquid into the flour-yeast mixture and beat with an electric mixer at medium speed for 2 minutes, or 300 strokes by hand, until smooth.
Add another 1/2 to 1 cup of flour and beat for 1 more minute.
Gradually stir in enough of the remaining flour to make a soft, slightly sticky dough.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 8-10 minutes until smooth, elastic, and no longer sticky.
Place the dough in a bowl coated with nonstick spray, turning once to coat the top. Cover with plastic wrap or a damp towel.
Let rise in a warm, draft-free place (80-85°F) until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch down the dough and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. Shape into desired forms: cloverleaf, crescents, Parker House, or simple round rolls.
Place shaped rolls on greased baking sheets or in greased muffin cups. Cover and let rise again until doubled, about 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
Brush with melted butter if desired and serve hot.

original_recipe.name: Fluffy Buttermilk Biscuits
instructions: Pre-heat oven to 450° F.
Sift dry ingredients together.
Combine oil, buttermilk, and flavoring without stirring and add all at once to dry ingredients.
Stir with a fork until mixture clings together and forms a ball.
Knead on a lightly floured board ten to twelve times with your fingertips.
Pat out dough from one-half to one inch in thickness.
Cut with a floured two-inch biscuit cutter.
Place on a baking sheet coated with a nonstick vegetable spray.
Bake in a PREHEATED oven for about ten minutes.

improved_recipe.name: Fluffy Buttermilk Biscuits
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C). Lightly coat a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray.
In a medium bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a measuring cup, combine the oil, buttermilk, and butter flavoring (if using) without stirring.
Pour the liquid mixture all at once into the dry ingredients. Stir gently with a fork just until the mixture clings together and forms a shaggy ball. Do not overmix.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. With lightly floured fingertips, gently knead the dough 10-12 times until it just comes together.
Pat or roll the dough out to 1/2 to 1 inch thickness. For fluffier biscuits, use 1 inch thickness.
Using a floured 2-inch biscuit cutter, cut straight down without twisting. Place biscuits on the prepared baking sheet, close together for soft sides or spaced apart for crisp sides.
Gather scraps gently, pat out, and cut more biscuits.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the tops are golden brown.
Brush with melted butter if desired and serve hot with butter, jam, or gravy.

original_recipe.name: Banana Nut Bread
instructions: Combine mashed bananas, sugar, egg and margarine in large bowl.
In another bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt.
Add dry ingredients to banana mixture, stirring just until moistened.
Fold in nuts.
Spoon batter into an 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 x 2 1/2 inch loaf pan that has been coated with a nonstick vegetable spray.
Bake at 350° F for 55 to 60 minutes, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool in pan 10 minutes.
Remove from pan, and let cool on wire rack.

improved_recipe.name: Classic Banana Nut Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8.5x4.5-inch loaf pan or coat with nonstick spray.
In a large bowl, mash the bananas with a fork until mostly smooth (some small lumps are fine).
Add the sugar, beaten egg, and melted margarine or butter to the bananas. Mix well.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add the dry ingredients to the banana mixture and stir just until combined. Do not overmix.
Fold in the chopped nuts.
Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 55-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean and the top is golden brown.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Slice and serve. Store wrapped in plastic wrap at room temperature for up to 3 days, or refrigerate for up to 1 week.

original_recipe.name: Pumpkin Bread
instructions: Cream sugar and margarine; add eggs and beat.
